name: Neck Oil
description: The idea was to create a beer that we could drink from 8am in the morning, all day, every day! A brew that you could make your ‘go to’ at any time and still function. So we took decided that this needed to be low ABV, ultra-pale, crisp, light and bang on in your face with the hops! The name comes from an old Black Country term in the middle of England my Great Granddad used to shout on his way out the door: “I’m going down the pub for a pint of neck oil!” Basically he wanted to drink his favourite local beer on mass and lube his thirst after a long hard day in the foundry. This is exactly what we do at the brewery. It’s our everyday, all day, go to Session IPA.

name: Lupuloid
description: Introducing the newest addition to our meticulous lineup of core range offerings, LUPULOID IPA, a 6.7% ABV India Pale Ale. The most notable thing is that it is our first straight up IPA, no funny business, just malt, yeast, water and hops. Lots of hops. I guess it only took us four years!

name: Gamma Ray
description: Big, hoppy and fresh. Juicy American hops added in ever increasing amounts at the end of the boil and in the fermenter to give huge flavor and aroma.

name: Tempus Project: Metamorph IV
description: Rotating Tempus IPA featuring different wild yeast strains, which will continue to evolve over time in package from the juicy, fruit-forward beer you have now, to a funkier, more complex beer. This batch hopped heavily in the hopback, fermented with Brettanomyces bruxellensis Trois Vrai, and dry-hopped with 9g/L of Ekuanot, El Dorado, and Azacca.

name: Double Chin
description: A double version of our first ever beer, “Neck Oil,” brewed to celebrate our Fourth Birthday, everybody who has helped us over the years and all those around us who make great beer!

name: Bloody 'Ell
description: Here we take a stripped back IPA malt bill and highly hop it with the tropics of Amarillo and Citra and pile head on with kilos of Blood Orange zest and juice late in the boil, bringing you a smack of citrus and hints of warm orange aromas.

name: Venus
description: Brewed in collaboration with Glasshouse for our 8th birthday we wanted to make a juicy IPL. Using German hops as a nod to traditional lagers and the addition of more modern tropical hops in the dry hop has given us a drinkable 'crispy boy' with a more hop forward IPA character. Still true to itself as a lager, but bolder like an IPA. Fermented cold and lagered for 6-8 weeks the beer was dry hopped with 7g/L Callista, Loral, El Dorado, Azzaca and Idaho Gem - its light, fruity and drinkable. Light and drinkable with a delicate and fruity hop character. Notes of melon and pineapple add an upfront juicy aroma whilst the use of traditional hops and lagering techniques give the beer a mellow lager backbone.

name: London Steam Lager
description: The original gold rush, London Steam Lager is anything but your average lager. Pouring a beautiful pale gold, it has a subtle malt sweetness, with aroma notes of lemon and peach from the Liberty and Crystal hops. Layered on top is a noble, lightly spicy hoppiness that gives the beer a complexity not found in other lagers. A lager for non-lager drinkers?

name: Picnic Session IPA
description: IPA its citrusy-berry blast of aroma and palate-tingling bitterness. Drink all-day every day.

name: Patriot Pale Ale
description: This pale ale starts with a light caramel and biscuit base and layers it with notes of citrus and rosewater from the Columbus and Amarillo hops. Just right for your next tailgating party! ...or a nice game of beer pong @ the Taproom!

name: Southie Stout
description: A stout to warm and refresh. Rich and silky from the oatmeal and black as coal. US hops give it a wicked citrusy-herbal kick. Batter up.

name: Thames Surf IPA
description:
Hoppy, bitter, bold, Thames Surf is our West-Coast IPA.
 
 A beer borne of a misspent youth drinking classic American IPAs (in America) during the 1990s.
 
 Pouring deep orange, with warm copper tones, expect aromas of bubblegum, peach and orange peel.
 
 Break through the surface and prepare to be hit by a wave of pithy fruit, pine and citrus from the combination of some of our favourite American hops.
 
 Please remember to Surf & drink responsibly.

name: Rock Lobster NEPA
description:
Thick as a bowl of New England chowder but minus the clams you'll be pleased to hear.
 
 This New England Pale Ale delivers a fruit bomb of flavour courtesy of Sultana & Simcoe hops that sit on top of a silky, lush malt base that includes malted wheat and oats.

name: Mochaccino IPA
description: This Mochaccino IPA will give you loads of chocolate & coffee with just a hint of hops

name: Wicked Good Ale
description: A truly wicked concoction of toasted malts and pumpkin with a bewitching blend of spice and a splash of maple syrup. Willamette hops add a devilishly bitter glint. Orange hues flicker like a copper cauldron caught in the candlelight.

name: Experimental Brew #27 - Oak Stout
description: Oak stout with hints of caramel.

name: Commonside Pale Ale
description:
The first pale ale we ever brewed, inspired by the classic American Pale Ales that kick started a craft beer revolution.
 
 When you think of a classic American Pale Ale - who do you think of?
 
 Sierra Nevada? Oskar Blues? Flying Dog? Anchor?
 
 All these and more were the inspiration for our Commonside Pale Ale, named after the beautiful Wandsworth Common that we call home.
 
 Keeping true to the style, we use all American hops, grown in the Willamette and Yakima valleys of the American Pacific Northwest.
 
 Delicious citrus and pine aroma jumps out of the glass, complemented by a biscuity malt sweetness and a lemony, herbal & bitter finish.

name: Prêt à Porter
description: Layers of roasted, toasted and smoked malt form a blanket around your taste-buds. With every mouthful of this Porter comes a little more warmth to help you through the long dark Winter nights.

name: Calif-Oregon Amber
description: A rich deep malty ale with the inner glow of a Californian self-help guru. A cool Pacific breeze from Magnum, Amarillo and Willamette hops help to give it the necessary zip.

name: Red Wheat N' Blue
description: The warm blush of summer ripples through this blueberry wheat IPA. Mosaic hops gently coax out the bursting berry flavor and the red hues of a summer sunset shine through the haze.

name: Reliance Pale Ale
description:
Biscuity malts, pine aromas and citrus flavours.
 An easy drinking beer for all occasions. English Maris Otter barley provides a clean, crisp backdrop to bright hop flavours.

name: Off-Grid
description: Brewed to celebrate London Beer City’s “Battle of the Beer Shops”, this New England style IPA is a beautiful smooth hit of hazy, oat-brewed goodness, with an intense, fruity flavour of tropical fruits and summer berries.

name: Diamond Geezer
description: As bold as brass and in your face beer. A hoppy red ale with a touch of caramel sweetness to start, then light nuttiness with a heavily hopped bitter finish.

name: Wolfie Smith
description:
An amber fusion of flavours. Light caramel with a big hop finish and a bitter bite.
 
 Power to the people, and freedom for Tooting!!

name: Hopadelic
description: ‘New World’ hops from North-West America, specifically The Yakima Valley, are full of fruity, tropical and citrus notes. This beer was inspired by these hops by which blends three of our favourite hops to create a wave of tropical hop flavour. We also ensure there is enough bitterness in this beer to compliment the rousing tropical hop which leaves the taste clean and crisp, and all brewed to a low 4.3% abv, meaning you can enjoy all that hop & flavour without feeling too tipsy, far out man! Far out

name: Dusk Til Dawn
description: Nice and fruity quencher

name: Stiff Upper Lip
description: A well balanced mellow malt gives the beer a clear and rich body whilst a myriad of well selected hops leaves the beer with a wonderfully crisp late bitter finish.

name: Chateau Rouge
description: Has the earthy Saison going on, with almost tartness from the wine Barrels. Good.

name: Cosmic Warrior
description: Nostalgic glam-rock 70s rock stardom gave us the name Cosmic Warrior, and a beer brewed with all the things we wanted in one place. We used Oats and Wheat in the mash, then the blend of hops is what gives this beers its flowing flamboyance where we use English Goldings offering subtle floral spice then with big additions of Amarillo & Centennial, two American hops that really push the fruit hop flavours home. ‘Get it on, Bang a gong’ T-Rex ’71

name: Camden Unfiltered Hells
description:
LIVE AND UNPLUGGED IN CAMDEN.
 If Hells is our studio album, all slick finish and crisp sounds, then Unfiltered Hells is our live album. We leave the yeast in for a full bodied beer that’s just that little bit louder, bigger and real, man.

name: HOLS
description:
Long haul flights, luggage stamps and lounge music
 
 Bermuda shorts and Hawaiian shirts, sunglasses and sun cream, Trinidad, St Tropez, and tan lines. Going on your hols is a break from the usual, and a chance to have fun. With this in mind, we created Camden Hols Lager. Happy holidays!

name: Show Off
description: Lager’s typecast as refreshing, but capable of so much more. We’re proud to show off all the things our favourite beer style can be. Crisp and clean, of course, but also hoppy and juicy, like this little number. Ta-da!

name: Camden Pale Ale
description:
WE LOVE OUR AMERICAN COUSINS.
 But sometimes they can be kind of full on. So we’ve crafted this beer to more British tastes. Made with American hops, it’s still got all the punch of a pale ale. Just less shouty.

name: I.P.A.
description: A well balanced IPA overflowing with fragrant new world hops.

name: Cowcatcher
description: Named after the grille at the front of the old US steam trains, is an American Pale Ale, generously hopped and full bodied. Refreshing and a great summer beer.

name: Flatiron Red
description: This mahogany red beer is a beautiful marriage of malts and hops. Elegantly balanced, notes of caramel, toffee, and toasted grains are complemented by bright, citrusy and tropical American hop character with a smooth finish.

name: Shape Shifter IPA
description: Island, inland, canoe or swim. Busy days in city haze, crystal clear water in a tree-lined bay. Stand in the snow and watch snowflakes, row deep lakes to catch great snakes. Choose your adventure, drink good beer. Hop-forward mango and grapefruit deliver intense, tropical flavours

name: Juicebox Citrus IPA
description: Mountain, waterfall, hike or climb. Meet fond friends in far-flung bars, share well-worn stories about long-healed scars. Climb over boulders, traverse round bends, stand on a peak looking at the worlds end. Choose your adventure, drink good beer. Fresh orange zest, flavours of mango and papaya, the aroma of good times

name: Easy Peeler
description: Beach bar, hammock, surf or bike. Roll your trousers to your knees, embrace the sun that breaks the trees. Walk in the rain in a grey raincoat, sit on the sand and watch boats float. Easy Peeler offers prominent tangerine and citrus flavours, low bitterness and a refreshing finish.

name: Basecamp
description: Foothills, woodland, camp or climb. Strap a pack across your back, explore new places without a map. Find new ways to leave the ground, pitch a tent as the sun goes down. Basecamp is crisp, dry and refreshing with a floral, spicy aroma.

name: Hemisphere Session IPA
description: Forest, foothills, hike or fly. Peaceful days on sunny trails, crazy nights under city lights. Dig for treasure under the moon, search the horizon by hot air balloon. Hemisphere offers vibrant tropical flavours, a gentle bitterness and a clean, hoppy finish.

name: Snowblind
description: Snowblind reclaims the traditional implication of Stout meaning strong or robust, rather than dark. With lactose and flaked oats alongside roasted coffee, cocoa nibs and fresh vanilla pods you get a body and flavour that provide the full Stout experience. It’s the Tonka beans that make this moreish, adding more vanilla, liquorice, caramel and almond.

name: Daintree
description: The Daintree in Australia’s tropical north is an idyllic escape where rainforest meets the sea, and was the ideal inspiration for this Mango Smoothie IPA. Expect more body than your run-of-the-mill IPA. Tropical and citrus hops and a large dosing of fresh mango purée give this beer an exotic aroma, with lower bitterness and a more prominent fruit character offering flavours of mango, peach and passion fruit.

name: Deucebox
description:
Citrus Double IPA
 
 Deucebox oranges are harvested by blasting California Dreaming through very large speakers at such a high intensity, the fruit just falls from the trees and juices itself. These are then added to our Citrus IPA recipe with twice the juice to serve up a punchy, tropical glass of joy, every time.

name: Star City
description: Some of the greatest adventures start in the most unexpected ways. Take Helen Sharman for example; she became the first Brit in space thanks to answering an advert that simply stated, ‘Astronaut wanted. No experience necessary.’ This collaboration with Mothership aims to celebrate pioneering women like Helen and blast you to the furthest reaches of flavour. Liberally hopped with Enigma and El Dorado, this Double IPA showcases all that is good about dank and juicy IPAs and promises to boldly take you where no man has gone before.

name: Flavourly Collaboration: Table Beer
description: ourpure in collaboration with Flavourly as part if their crowdsourced marketing campaign.

name: Our House
description: A light and hoppy hazy pale ale brewed to celebrate our 8th birthday, with Citra and Centennial hops for citrus and tropical notes.

name: Soul Trader
description:
Taking inspiration from the entrepreneurial spirit that drives London life, this version of Soul Trader is made from just a single variety of 2018 Braeburn apples and fermented on-site by Roberto.
 Pale and bubbly in appearance, the lightly sparkling cider bursts with orange and floral notes that give way to a yeast-like background. Similar in feel to a light champagne, the balanced taste delivers a twist of apple tart, and a pleasing acidity that makes it the ideal precursor to a delicious meal.

name: Grapefruit New England IPA
description: A collaboration with Unbarred Brewery. It's an unfiltered grapefruit NEIPA that's packs a fruity punch

name: Deep End
description:
This is a new DDH NEIPA recipe stacked with Citra, Mosaic and Nelson hops.
 
 This full-powered and superbly drinkable NEIPA has a mouthwateringly peachy and tropical aroma, while massive hop additions deliver juicy white grape flavours with notes of tangerine and mango.

name: Dance Juice
description: The definitive version of our classic New England IPA. Packed with Azacca, Simcoe, Ekuanot, and Citra hops for a tropically fruity brew with low bitterness. Juicy with a full mouthfeel

name: Pale - Mosaic & Ekuanot
description: Your standard pale ale.

name: Hackney Hopster
description: The Hackney Hopster is a debonair young chap of a pacific pale ale. Dressed in New Zealand & US hops, the Hopster shows off flavours of grapefruit, lemon zest and gooseberry, with a dry and fresh finish.

name: Yakima Red
description: Meantime Yakima Red is brewed with British and German malts to give a deep ruby colour and medium to full body. The addition of five varieties of US hop from the Yakima Valley in Washington State imparts spectacular fruit and citrus flavours with a restrained bitterness. Yakima Red is 4.1% ABV and delivers all the flavour and character you come to expect from Meantime's variety of craft beer styles.

name: London Pale Ale
description:
One hundred and fifty years ago the new bitter beer style, Pale Ale, was so popular that brewers had to import Californian hops to meet demand. Meantime London Pale Ale continues that tradition by combining lots of American Cascade and Centennial hops to give it a complex citrus aroma and bucketsful of local Kentish Goldings to provide the bitterness that makes the style so refreshing.
 
 Together they conspire to assail the nose with a complex, heady mix of spearmint, grass and 'hop sack' aromas, fruity citrus flavours and a bitter finish that makes pale ale drinking a truly rewarding experience.

name: Westway Pale Ale
description: A traditional golden pale brewed with a combination of classic British hops for bitterness & spice and US Cascade for fruity, citrus notes. We carefully blend three different malt varieties for body and the rich biscuit quality which defines the style. Brewed at a sessionable 3.8% Westway Pale Ale is a classic cask ale brewed the West (London) way

name: Pale Fire
description: Our house pale ale delivers plenty of hop character. Drink fresh!

name: I’m Walkin’ Here!!! (Skyline Project 2019)
description: Juicy DIPA brewed in collaboration with Barrier Brewing Co. out of NYC.

name: Behind Door Number 3
description:
We're finishing off 2019 with one heck of a beer!
 Behind Door Number 3 is the culmination of a year's worth of experimentation pushing fruity and juicy hops to the maximum.
 Big hitter hops + London Fog yeast = a beer worth waiting all year for

name: Understanding Whole Systems
description: Methodically blow your mind. Understanding Whole Systems is an IPA of substance and curiosity, an exploration of taste through the prism of Citra hops and a complete presentation London Fog yeast. Soft and hazy, complex and full. We enjoy drinking whilst reading entries from Pressure Drop’s own catalog, printed on the label.

name: Am I Being Basic?
description:
Idaho 7, Mosaic & Simcoe NEIPA
 
 "I’m sorry that people are so jealous of me. But I can’t help it that I’m popular.”

name: Lucky
description:
ho said NEIPAs had to be juice, juice, and nothing but the juice?
 
 With an aroma full of peach, and a resinous aftertone, Lucky shows you the full range of what Simcoe can do. A New England cousin to Alligator Tugboat, our Simcoe-celebrating West Coast IPA, Lucky has the full-bodied softness you would expect of a NEIPA, with a piney twist and bitter finish that leaves you wanting more.
 
 The artwork is designed by Graham, one of Pressure Drop’s three founders/owners and is inspired by pop art and watching vintage episodes of Batman on a Saturday morning. POW!
 
 As the poet and philosopher, Britney Jean Spears, once said, “she’s so Lucky, she’s a star”

name: Welcome to the Internet
description:
Positivity is the way!
 Mosaic is the future!
 NE DIPA = BBF 4 LYF!
 
 Doggos for president!
 Welcome To The Internet!
 
 Be nice, make friends, eat bread

name: Five Points Pale
description: A rich, aromatic pale ale generously hopped with Citra, Amarillo and Centennial hops.

name: Jupa
description:
JUPA is a 5.5% juicy, fruity Pale Ale and the newest addition to our core range.
 Hopped with Simcoe in the boil and dry-hopped with Citra and Mosaic, JUPA has bold, juicy citrus flavours and a tropical fruit character bursting with pineapple, mango and papaya. It was brewed with a touch of wheat and oats for a silky malt backbone, allowing the West Coast hops to shine.
 JUPA’s low bitterness differentiates it from our Pale Ale and XPA and makes it a real thirst-quencher that’s juicy and totally crushable.

name: Five Points XPA
description: Formerly known as Ten Points Extra Pale, our collaboration with Field Day Festival, our Five Points XPA is an Extra Pale Ale brewed with Citra and Galaxy hops.

name: Double Dry-Hopped IPA
description:
A 6.2% Double Dry-Hopped IPA, brewed with Lost and Grounded Brewers.
 
 Australian hops Vic Secret and Ella, grapefruity tropical flavours, and a nice, refreshing bitterness.

name: Baller
description:
An IPA. We took everything we’ve learnt about making IPAs and put it into this beer. Lots of hops, big bright flavours, smooth body. It’s our go-to IPA.
 
 Born and bred in London.

name: Hepcat
description: A Session IPA. Our mainstay and our original. It’s everything the style should be – fruity nose, juicy body, bright taste.

name: Eins Zwei G’suffa
description: Eins Zwei, G’suffa is a collaboration with The Gipsy Hill Brewing Co. It’s a traditionally brewed Weissbier, with a load of extra hops thrown in, making it a Hopfenweisse. Brewed to celebrate Oktoberfest, it’s got banana notes, big body, bready mouthfeel and tropical hop notes. Featuring Tobi & James, our brewers in the MM Brewgarden

name: Bandit
description: A Gluten Free Pale Ale. We took our beloved Beatnik and stole the gluten out. It’s a light, refreshing pale. Still fruity, still floral. Loads of flavour, just gluten free.

name: Overkill
description: Overkill is a New England IPA. A collaboration with Warpigs Brewpub, it’s big brash and pumped full of experimental US hops. Pineapple and stone fruit aromas carried forward by a nine grain grist, backed up with juicy esters from Vermont Yeast.

name: Pale Ale Centennial
description: ABV will vary, but recipes remain the same. Seen in 5.0, 5.4%, and 5.5% ABV.

name: Crafty Apple
description: Our very first own brand cider! Brimming with juicy flavour from a blend of 3 well known Herefordshire apple. Known for it's butterscotch and toffee notes.

name: Naked Ladies
description:
Outstanding, glorious, hoppy golden ale using Herkules, Celeia and Chinook hops for full-flavoured satisfaction.
 Inspired by the statues of water nymphs in York House gardens in Twickenham, known locally as the “Naked Ladies”.
 Silver – Champion Beer of Britain 2014 London & SE Golden Ale category and Won the Best Bitters category at Reading Beer Festival 2008 and 2011.

name: Pale Beauty
description: Clear pale wheat ale in the English tradition. Robustly hopped with aromatic varieties, it is extremely refreshing and dangerously drinkable. Wheat accounts for 40% of the malt grist.

name: Rye Smile
description: Mandarina hopped rye ale

name: Grandstand
description:
A well-hopped and well balanced, brownish amber refreshing session beer.
 Refreshing, with light citrus hoppy notes and a fresh clean finish.

name: Summer Down Under
description: Using the Galaxy and Pacific Jade hops from Australia and New Zealand this beer is brewed in honour of our Southern Friends. To off-set the dark nights this light golden ale, bursting with citrusy flavours, is a perfect break from the Winter Gloom.

name: Summer Sun
description: Extra pale ale malt and wheat malt combine with aromatic hops for a hoppy nose and aromas of tangerine and pineapple. A spicy very dry hop palate and a really dry lasting bitter finish.

name: Rafiki
description: Our low-strength IPA, and a family fave. Tropical notes of mango, passionfruit and guava come from Mosaic and Ekuanot. Smooth bitterness and a sweet biscuity malt flavour.

name: Session
description: Old gold in colour with a zesty nose, clean malt body and satisfying hop finish, Volden Session (formerly Vim) is a beer that is purposefully moreish.

name: DDH IPA
description: A double dry hopped India Pale Ale.

name: Copper Leaf
description: Copper Leaf Ale, burst of citrus, floral and tropical flavours from America and British hops overlay the complex malt characters of rye, caramel and spice. A refreshingly dry finish compliments this American Red Ale.

name: Bravo
description:
"Brewed to celebrate the American craft beer renaissance – showcasing American hop variety – Bravo.
 
 A pronounced blackcurrant, citrus aroma. Fruity & crisp on the palate, with a refreshingly bitter bite to finish."

name: Windmill Spring Ale
description: Expect hints of melon, zesty fruit and herb aromas to overlay this refreshing and balanced spring ale, finishing with a satisfying subtle malt finish.

name: Wimbledon XK
description:
The XK is the baby brother of our XXXK barleywine. Using the residual weaker sugar wort from the brewing the high strength barleywine, we have brewed this ‘small beer’, adding chocolate and caramel malts to add further body and depth of flavour. This style is often referred to as a Mild.
 
 
 The aroma shows hints of chocolate, toasted oak, plums and herbs. On the palate this balanced beer has notes of malt, red fruit and chocolate with a smooth finish.
